name: Chapter 1 - The Basics
description: The following only has the most basic things that one would need to know about this new world, some, or all of it you may already know, but it's always good for a refresher course!

quests.name: How to use the book!
quests.description: So, you have this fancy journal, it's our way of communicating with you, letting you know how the world you're in works and better yet how to conquer it. Oh! Make sure you check out your Inventory first [The E Key] before you get started on these quest!

tasks.longDescription: So This part is pretty simple, all we need you to do is go ahead and punch a tree and get some wood. This is a detection task, we just want to see if it's in your inventory!

Alright, so the next kind of quest we can give you is to craft an object, once you have crafted it the quest will be completed! To craft these blocks just put that log you got into the 2x2 Crafting square in your inventory (next to that handsome picture of you!)

This next part is called a "Cosume task" where we're going to use magic to take what you make back to our own world! So in this one we need you to craft a workbench. This is just done by putting those 4 wood blocks you made in a square. Though... we're going to take it so you may need to make another one... sorry!

quests.name: Tools are not for Fools!
quests.description: This is a strange and new world to you, and you're going to need some items to make the world just a /hint/ easier. In this case... things to help you shape the world.

tasks.description: I mine every day and Night!
tasks.longDescription: Alright so, the first thing you want to be able to do is dig up rocks. This is your tool! The pick axe is made with sticks and planks. If you aren't sure how to make it be sure to search "Wooden Picaxe" in the search bar and you can use the [R] Key to see the recipie (this should work for most things).

quests.name: Storage Wars
quests.description: So you may have noticed when you checked your inventory back there that you don't have a lot of space. Well... we should help clear that up. As you get achievements in this world you might find you're able to carry more, but just in case...

tasks.description: I've got junk in my trunk
tasks.longDescription: For this one, you'll simply need to use that Crafting Bench we had you make twice and 8 wooden blocks. Make them in a square pattern in the 3x3 Grid and you can have your very own storage. Note that if you put 2 next to each other they should connect!

quests.name: A Solid Upgrade
quests.description: Those wooden tools are great and all, but they don't mine all that much and they break pretty easily. I bet we can use some stone to make better tools

tasks.longDescription: Alright so this one is pretty simple, just like the wooden pick but instead of wood planks we need cobblestone. Give it a shot!

quests.name: Light Em Up!
quests.description: So... darkness is scary, and it really should be. At night the horrible creatures that inhabit this world aren't affected by the light of the sun and can spawn freely... but we can fix that

tasks.longDescription: To craft torches you're going to need to use that fancy pick of yours to mine up some coal. Look around for stone that looks like it has specs of black in it! Then combine that coal with sticks and wa-la! Torches!

quests.name: Stoking the Fires
quests.description: Alright, so admittedly it's a bit tough to have a place in the world without and oven, so let's make us a very basic one hmm?

tasks.longDescription: Furnaces are pretty simple, they let you put fuel in (wood, sticks, wooden tools, coal, charcoal and more) and then light the stuff on top on fire to get cool stuff out. The recipie is pretty simple too, but I'll let you figure it out (Remember if you're not sure search for it and use the [R] Key to find out what it is! )

quests.name: I am Iron Man
quests.description: Alright so working with Stone makes you feel like maybe you should be painting on cave walls, well... there's some other things in the world worth looking into

tasks.longDescription: Iron is at the core of... well almost everything. You'll find it near stone for the most part, but getting it is key to everything!
Now using the knowledge you've gathered, just throw some kind of fuel in your furance and this iron you just got on top and see if you aren't just a blaze with your acheivement

quests.name: Oh Hoe you didn't.
quests.description: Iron's useful for a few more things. It turns out that the agriculture industry may be more your thing... we think. Just give it a shot.

tasks.longDescription: This tools handy, if there's water 4 blocks near some dirt, you can right click with this tool and it will become tilled soil. With that you can plant all kinds of fun things. You should expiriment!

quests.name: Cutting Edge Technology
quests.description: As you may or may not have noticed, you happen to live in a very dangerous world. Maybe you should do something about that? Like... I don't know, make a sword!

tasks.longDescription: This is your swords, there are many like it, but this one will be yours (for a time). It's simple to make, 2 Cobblestone and a stick!

quests.name: You're boned
quests.description: So we've realized there's some /really/ nasty creatures where you live, but we want to get you aquainted with at least a few of the more common ones.

tasks.longDescription: Zombies are proflific, but worst of all they are bitey. They are slow and mostly stick to melee, but they usually burn in direct sunlight.
Skeletons prefer to attack from a distance, favoring a bow and arrow. But they tend to be brittle and also have a certain dislike of sunlight

That's a nice home you have there. It would be a shame if ssssssomething were to happen to it. These green, probably pete moss based creatures tend to explode and they have no qualms about wondering around in sunlight.

quests.name: Putting bread on the table
quests.description: Alright so you've played around with your gardening device, but let's see if you can actually grow anything. It's time to... put some bread on the table.

tasks.longDescription: These puns are getting terrible, but your farming skills better not be. First throw some normal seeds in the ground. That's simple enough right... well if you can find them. They tend to be in the grass, you should try tilling it and see
So if you plant that seed, give it a little time and eventually when it's fully grown, right click it, you will find it gives you wheat. Use that wheat to make some bread and what do you get?

quests.name: Not Cod, Cod do batter...
quests.description: Alright, so you're probably a bit hungry after all that work. I certainly can't blame you for that. But did you know if you use a bit of string and wood you too can find your own dinner tonight

tasks.longDescription: Alright, so... string seems weird, but don't worry I heard those 8 legged poisonous things cough it up when they die. Maybe you could... fish it out of them? Eh... ehh? Ok we'll stop.

quests.name: Leather tis nobler
quests.description: You may have seen some creatures around you in the world.  Did you know that if you stab them that sometimes they drop nifty things. Well that swords should help you with that. Some may fight back though

tasks.longDescription: Cows are the most likely to drop this sort of thing, so don't be afraid to murder one brutally for it's precious bits.

quests.name: The Cake is a lie
quests.description: Alright so it's not, but if you make this little treat you'll probably find by now at least (assuming you've been following our little guide) you feel like you can carry just a bit more.

tasks.longDescription: Cakes take a few things, but we think you can figure it out with a bucket, some cows, a chicken, some sugar cane, and a bit of wheat. Try not to eat the whole thing at once

quests.name: Bedding with the Enemy
quests.description: This world is a crappy place, there is no doubt about that, but you want to know what makes it even crappier? Night Time. Sure enough just when you're about ready to settle down for the evening every single monster and it's mother wants to eat you... but what if you could just sleep through it soundly?

tasks.longDescription: Beds are nifty things, not only do they let you sleep through the night if you're somewhere safe, but they also set your spawn point!

quests.name: Diamonds are Forever
quests.description: Alright, so maybe diamonds aren't quite forever, but they are fairly important to you know... exisiting. They are only found at the depths of the earth, but be careful down there, They're tricky!

tasks.longDescription: You're going to need an Iron Pick axe for this one... but we're going to let you figure out that one all on your own. But going deep underground with your iron pickaxe you should find a vein of diamond eventually. Be careful though, the lava monsters probably bite.

quests.name: Raise Shields
quests.description: Alright so you can't quite tell Mr. Worf to raise shields, but you can construct a bit of armor. It's not the best but it should help a bit.

tasks.longDescription: This armor won't last long and it won't soak up all the damage, but it's good to stand between you and whatever it is that wishes to murder you. You should definately give it a shot.

quests.name: Hard as Glass
quests.description: The world you live in is a tough one, but what if we told you there's worse? Well you need to find out. But to find out you're going to need to make some diamond tools.

tasks.longDescription: These are the final set of tools to complete that fall under the category of "Normal" but you're going to need them in order to get at what we really want... Obsdian.
Now if you've never made obsidian before then it's really simple. Just dump a bucket of water on a bit of lava and wa la you have some obsidian... but we're going to need a lot.

Alright, so what you need to do next involves a bit of Flint, Steel, and an Obsidian Ring that's about Oh 5 Tall, and 4 wide (so 5 obsidian blocks going up with 4 across in a really more square shape). I'm sure you can figure out the Filnt and Steel (Really iron but who's counting?)

quests.name: Char-itable options
quests.description: Sometimes finding coal can be difficult, and this is something that we can all understand, but worry not fellow travelers there is another option now that you have this fancy furnace!

tasks.longDescription: So if you are low on coal, you do actuallly have an option, and in this case it is to burn a log with some other fuel (Maybe even another log) to make charcoal!

quests.name: The Path to knowledge
quests.description: The very key to this world is knowledge, and knowledge is power, so guard it well. But more importantly then that, how do we aquire knowledge?

tasks.longDescription: To start down this path we're going to need something simple... well mostly simple. Sugar Cane, you see it happens to double as a wonderful source of paper if you craft it right, so go find some!
From here instead of making it into what we want to (Sugar) we're instead going to make it into something useful for us... paper.

tasks.description: I knew you had the lobes
tasks.longDescription: Now that this is done, the next step is simple. You just put the paper along with some leather and you can make your very first book!

quests.name: Weathered Down
quests.description: You may have noticed that the clouds are just slightly different then they usually are. If anything they seem to have something out for you. I bet you'd love to know when they /really/ want to kill you

tasks.longDescription: So you don't have a helicopter (Yet) but you do have a way to show yourself what's coming your way. Build yourself a fancy weather forecast device with a Compass, some Redstone, and some Iron
Make that compass a diamond and you can /control/ the very weather around you, but be mindful with great power comes great responsibility!
Using that weather machine you can now passively deflect weather. Simply put a weather defelctor down and watch it go to work. It's really quite amazing!

quests.name: A Crooked Salesmen
quests.description: Running low on string? Maybe even saplings for those trees that you're trying to grow well do we have the deal for you! The crook, made with either bone or sticks is perfect for getting those leaves out of trees and you might even get a surprise.

tasks.longDescription: Collect some saplings and then a silk worm by using the crook on leaves. You can even cook those little silk worms if you want, but we advise against it.

We're running a bit low on string ourselves, and we were wondering if you could send some through. Now to get string easily use the silk worm on some tree leaves and let it get to infesting. Once it's completly infested instead of dropping saplings it will drop string. But be careful the silk worms spread across every leaf they can touch so if you're planning on using that tree for more saplings you better plan ahead.

quests.name: Sieveing with Envy
quests.description: Alright so there are a few more things we can do with string that might help you with your resource problem. But for this we're going to need to construct a special device.

tasks.longDescription: Admittedly these little pieces require a lot of string but we feel that the end goal has got to be worth it in some way right?
Once you have those 2 Mesh's just stick them between some planks and give it little sticks for legs and you have your first sieve, but why are we having you make this anyway?

You can use the sieve to sift through various itesm. Sand, Gravel, Dirt, and even another object that you'll discover later called dust. But for now sift through a few pieces of Sand and Gravel and see if you can't find some Iron. By combining 4 of these pieces together (Of each type) you can make your own iron to smelt just as if you'd found it underground yourself!

quests.name: En-Ranged
quests.description: So some of the monsters in this world tend to be able to hit you at a distance. We imagine that can't be any fun, so isn't it time you got a weapon to shoot back at them? Well it's time to learn how to make the bow and arrow!

tasks.longDescription: A bow should be a pretty simple affair, Be sure to get some string from those spiders (3 in fact) and then with 3 sticks you should be able to make your very first bow... but somethings a miss. What is a bow without ammunition?

Flint can be found in gravel sometimes, like a rare drop. Feathers are often dropped by chickens, and sticks... well you should know where sticks come from by now. Put them all together and you can make your very own arrow.
Send us some arrows so that we can check the quality and find out what exactly it is you need. Then we'll send you some back. Doesn't that sound like a plan?

quests.name: Stop, Hammer Time!
quests.description: One more tool that you may find yourself using on your adventures is something called the hammer. Now this hammer is useful for turning Stone into Cobblestone, Cobblestone into Gravel, Gravel into Sand... And Sand into dust.

tasks.longDescription: With Two Sticks and two pieces of iron you can make your very own hammer, It's great for any number of things, but you should play around with it and find out!

quests.name: Sandy Shores
quests.description: Have you ever seen your house and thought to yourself "Boy I wish this block was something I could see through?" Well wish no more, with the invention of glass, you too can have your own glorious see through house!

tasks.longDescription: Sand can be all throughout the world, found near sources of water, but also in the vast expanses of desert. It shouldn't take you too long to find some.
Glass is a transparent block that you can get by simply putting sand into a furnance and letting it be cooked by a various source of fuel. Give it a try!

It's rumored that the invention of glass had a large part to do with scientific progress in europe in the early centuries that allowed it to advance ahead of china, but that's another goofy discussion for another goofy day. Today it seems you've got some glassware to make

quests.name: Getting Stoned
quests.description: Did you know you can do more with that furnace then simply cook up a bit of meat or metal? Oh indeed you can even turn your cobblestone into smooth stone which is useful for just looking pretty some days

tasks.longDescription: Simply throw in a fuel and then your cobblestone and before you know it you'll be making your own castle in the sky out of smooth stone.

quests.name: Travel By Sea
quests.description: One of the simpler creations that you can find yourself making is the boat. It's great for traveling across water though it does have a tendacy to break if you hit things to hard, so be gentle with it.

tasks.longDescription: Crafting the boat is simple. Simply take 5 Wooden Planks from the any of the trees around you and place them in the shape of a half chest (with the top 3 not present) and you'll have yourself your very first boat. As always don't be afraid to use the R key while hovering over the boat in the NEI menu if you aren't sure.

quests.name: Swiper no Swiping
quests.description: So you my have noticed that in this little pack of ours, there is a LOT of stuff. Well we want to help you with that, by giving you a place to put all your stuff.

tasks.longDescription: Backpacks are a great way to help with the fact that you just don't have enough space for all this stuff. So by taking 8 Leather and crafting them like a chest you can make your very own backpack. Also we want you to craft some bound leather, which is just leather mixed with string
Tanned leather can be gotten by taken that bound leather and cooking it for a bit. It's great for making /even/ bigger backpacks.

Finally we want to talk about the 2 of the 3 other versions of the backpack. One you can get by putting a crafting bench at the center of your backpack. One you get by making it out of tanned leather.

quests.name: Vroom Vroom Shroom
quests.description: Bread is great and all, but you're pretty sure that you need more then just carbs to get by, and you heard that mushrooms are packed full of protien so why not invetigate that?

tasks.longDescription: You can't very well have mushrooms if you have nothing to put them in? It's time to invest in bowls, which are made quite simply by placing 3 wood planks on the crafting bench in a bowl like shape
Everyone knows the the good mushrooms grow on the best kind of logs. So look around in caves and sometimes in certain biomes and you should find these common fungi
Once you've selected the best quality items it's time to combine them in the bowl. Simply add the red and brown mushrooms to the bowl on the crafting bench and you'll have an instant stew

quests.name: And A-door-able addition
quests.description: Sometimes you want to get into the place where you've put all your stuff, but you don't want other creatures to get in. That my friends is where the door comes in handy

tasks.description: Is it a door or a jar?
tasks.longDescription: The door is crafted by simply placing 6 wooden planks on the crafting bench in an upright rectangle. Most monsters can not open these, and only a few will be strong enough to break them down (On Hard).

Made much like the door, but instead of being upright the planks are along the bottom two rows of the crafting bench. These trapdoors are great for entrances to vertical points in your base (like Ladders or stairs)

quests.name: Cotton Pickin
quests.description: While silk worms offer a substantial return on investment, who can say no to yet another possible source of wool. It's time to learn about the textile industry

tasks.longDescription: You might just find some textiles out in the world, breaking these gardens will give you cotton which you can use in order to make string which will even give you wool.

What you might not realize is that you can go on to take some of those first cotton balls you find and pick the seeds from them. Right clicking on the seeds with soil that has been tilled by a ho and hydrated by being within at least 4 blocks horizontally of a water source block will let you grow your own cotton
